required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 3D Ultrasound Measurement of Junctional Zone Thickness and Its Relation to Implantation Success
clinical_study.official_title: Thickness of the Junctional Zone Measured by 3D Ultrasound and Its Relation to the Success/Failure Implantation Rates in Assisted Reproduction Techniques

brief_summary.textblock: 100 patients aged 21-40 years old, diagnosed as primary or secondary infertility . These patients are then assigned to receive fertility treatment (ovulation induction, ICSI, intrauterine insemination and IVF). They undergo a 3D vaginal ultrasound before treatment to measure the junctional zone thickness and followed up after treatment to determine the rate of implantation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks after pregnancy confirmation by pregnancy test

arm_group.description: These patients are then assigned to receive fertility treatment (ovulation induction, ICSI, intrauterine insemination and IVF). They undergo a 3D vaginal ultrasound before treatment to measure the junctional zone thickness and followed up after treatment to determine the rate of implantation and they became pregnant

These patients are then assigned to receive fertility treatment (ovulation induction, ICSI, intrauterine insemination and IVF). They undergo a 3D vaginal ultrasound before treatment to measure the junctional zone thickness and followed up after treatment to determine the rate of implantation and they remained non pregnant

intervention.description: ultrasound to measure the thickness of the junctional zone at day 21 of the cycle

study_pop.textblock: 100 patients aged 21-40 years old, diagnosed as primary or secondary infertility due to the following causes of infertility; ( Pelvic Inflammatory disease, dysovulation , tubal infertility, unexplained infertility, combined infertility or due to male factor ).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- infertile women
Exclusion Criteria:
- congenital uterine anomalies medical disease contraindicating pregnancy
